intro: Euthemis, commonly known as the euphorbia, is a genus of flowering plants in the spurge family, Euphorbiaceae. These plants are characterized by their milky sap, which can be toxic and cause skin irritation. Euthemis species are typically shrubs or herbs, often with simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. They are found in a variety of habitats, including arid regions and tropical forests. Many species are adapted to survive in harsh environments, showcasing a range of morphological and physiological adaptations.
